comment: Very professional. If you do what you are supposed to do; you will get the work that you put effort into.

Mojo jojo is just NOT a good professor. His accent and low speaking tone make it near impossible to understand anything he says. I basically had to teach myself. And might possibly have to take this course again depending on how I do the final. never in my life have I stressed this much about a math class. But dang, Abebe made that happen.
Tests count for half of your final grade. Attendance is mandatory even though the easiest parts of the homework are reviewed in class.
Simply the worst professor I've had. His accent also makes it very difficult to understand him. Do not take him.

His way of teaching is simply by giving example problems throughout the lecture. His accent also made it hard to understand most times. Unless you want to spend time teaching yourself throughout the entire course DO NOT TAKE HIM. It was very clear that did not care about any of his students or care for if we succeeded in the class.
Takes forever to respond back to emails if u miss quiz you have to take it in his office overall pretty easy class if you do the hw.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Homework and tests are on ALEKS expect for the final which is on paper. You are allowed to have a formula sheet for tests, and he drops your lowest test grade at the end of the semester. He does a lot of example problems during his lecture and is very welcoming to questions.
if you cant learn through aleks do not take his class.

Very kind and easy to learn professor. His accent made it difficult to understand, but his course was all on aleks which provides everything. I taught myself the whole course through aleks because of his accent, but he give ten study guide attempts and his study guides are exactly like the tests. Very easy class.

There is hw every week on Aleks but it is simple. his lectures just consist of going over the hw that week. exams are roughly 25 questions on aleks w/ no lockdown browser and he provides practice exams. he also allows a formula sheet to use on the test and does partial credit. it is a simple class and easy to pass
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: professor mojo is completely inaccessible outside of class, he has not answered a single email of mine and is incredibly difficult to get his attention for questions. he tried to refuse me from entering the classroom because i had my service dog with me, he assigns way to much homework and the study guides are nothing like his tests.

I love math so this was my favorite class I've taken. As long as you go to class and do the problems the Aleks homework should be pretty easy to understand. I would also do the practices tests, they are the same as the test just with different numbers. Made a 99 in this class.
pretty easy course, attendance is mandatory. he has office hours and your lowest test grade is dropped.

He is a nice professor besides his accent I mean it's not that hard to understand, all of the work is on Aleks, so if you keep up and do 5 topics a day you shouldn't be hind. besides the final, it was 23 questions. all his quizzes are on the computer but he gives u an option if u prefer paper.He does go over topics you don't understand as well
NOT ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE OF CLASS!!! He doesnt respond to emails and doesnt cover all of the homework for the week in class, absolutely terrible wouldnt recommend taking him

Way too much work in too little time. I honestly don't know how he wanted us to get done 11 different math topics in over a week while having other classes to attend to. Hard to understand him and doesn't do a great job at explaining things. The program he uses is frustrating and can be hard to get anything done in time. Would not recommend.

I had him for my 1st freshman semester and enjoyed having him. Although his lectures are dry they are very clear cut on what to learn and will answer any question. Pop quizzes are only for extra credit and my only complaint is alot of homework on aleaks but gives you around a week to do it.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: He doesn't offer any extra credit, has a very strong accent/hard to understand.

Mr. Mojo lectured very well, lots of note-taking and was easy to follow and understand despite his accent. Every lesson has a homework assignment so don't sit on them, knock them out each day after class as he made them due the Sunday before the unit test. Tests weren't on lockdown, used MyOpenMath for all assignments, tests, and final.

Mr. Mojo is a fine teacher, however, the amount of homework assigned is difficult. The program Aleks forces accuracy to progress. Every concept begins to turn to mush with the amount of homework assigned, making you truly feel like a "full time student." If you already juggle a lot of responsibilities like sports or a job, take a different class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Mojo is very adorable as a person and is a good teacher. Definitely take him, I would again if I had the chance to.

Took him in 2017. He does have a thick accent. You use myMathLab for homework. If you're not good at math, this class will be rather difficult (I mean, every math class is difficult, right?) He does his best at teaching, but it's not "top notch". Don't be afraid to ask questions. He's super helpful one on one. Tests are IN CLASS BUT on a computer!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Mojo is overall great. he really seems to care and will meet with you whenever you need to explain anything. he let us have a cheat sheet for every test and the final, and it could be a full sheet of paper front and back. the homework is very similar to the tests. only issue is theres ALOT of material to cover in class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I took MATH1111 with this professor because he had good reviews, but that has definitely changed. The lectures he gives are not helpful, you could learn the same thing from Google. Also, ALEKS is a terrible system. I spent way too much time on the hard homework and most times had to stop doing it and accept my incomplete grade. Would NOT recommend.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: All M1111 classes use ALEKS (not great) online system. Mr. Mojo dropped the lowest test grade, is available during office hours, a nice individual. I'm not great at math but I did the homework, attended class, took notes and made a B. He's a good teacher, accent is not difficult, the material goes fast but its not hard.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: This is the worst class I've ever had, and I'm a semester away from graduating. Imagine having to complete a college-level math course with a handful of examples. That's what you'll get here. Avoid ALEKS (the software used by this Prof) at all costs. I've spent over 100 hours of this semester logged in to this program, and I still might get a C.

Dr. Mojo had great reviews. And tbh, I am not sure why. He's a nice guy but doesn't enjoy what he does at all and makes no efforts to connect with his students. Partial credit isn't a thing because he uses an online program to grade everything for him. 70 kids at beginning of the semester an barely 25 left Midway through. Avoid

If you can take a math class online (teaching yourself) using examples, then you'll be fine. No curve, maybe a dropped test (?), 5-10 hours of HW weekly (REAL work - not what other profs might say), and online tests using a program that doesn't give partial credit, attendance mandatory... His lectures are like Google searches on the topic - 2/10.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He doesn't care about his students at all. He's hard to understand during lectures and barely explains how to solve the problems. He simply shows an example and moves on. He does allow a formula sheet, but refuses to give partial credit or curve. I'm constantly a high A student but I'm having to work for this grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: I am normally good at math if I apply myself. He taught things in class that were irrelevant on hw and tests. In this class I spent over 2hrs a day on hw, I failed tests, he speaks quietly, is VERY hard to understand, and moves too fast. He expects you to know what he is talking about without explaining anything. Avoid if you struggle with math.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I'm an "adult learner" meaning I'm in my late 20s and haven't taken a math course in 8 yrs. My GPA is 3.7. This was the second C I made in college (Senior now, back after a long break). I spent over 12hrs a week on HW, lots failed tests (68% of grade), he speaks quietly and is hard to understand, and moves too fast. Avoid if you struggle with Math.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Definitely take this professor! Everything is online through MyMathLab. Tests are online and in class except the final. Each test you can make your own formula sheet where you can work out problems if needed. Take advantage of his office hours if needed, he will show you how to work through what you don't understand.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: !00% recommend! He is not the best at teaching the concepts but he gives study guides for each test that are almost exactly the same as the tests. There are 5 tests and they are all taken online but in class. He allows one side of notebook paper for notes during the tests.

Professor Mojo gives every opportunity for his students to succeed in his class. There are five MyMathLab tests and a paper final. He lets you make a "cheat sheet" for each test, and drops your lowest test grade if you miss less than four classes. Take advantage of everything he gives you and you'll make an easy A.

I am terrible in Math. He gives students many opportunities to make an A. Every test comes with a studyguide. There are five test in total. The fourth test replaces a low test score. He also drops a lowest test only if you have missed less than three days of class. i made a 97. He is a extremely nice person. Best Math teacher I have ever had!

He has 5 Tests all said and done and 2 of them will get dropped if you have good attendance. He curves test up to a 70 average. Hes a nice guy. Allows a cheat sheet on tests. I got a 99 in his class after the final. He gives out fantastic study guides that are pretty much identical to the real tests. Do them 10 times and you are going to get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Loved his style of teaching. Didn't read straight from the textbook, provided his own notes and examples. Homework is the usual, on mylab math.

One of my favorite professors. I was dreading a calculus-based class, but I ended up going into my final with a 97 average. There are 5 tests, but he drops the lowest 2 if you have less than 3 absences. You can use a formula sheet and a calculator on every exam. He has very good study guides for each test to help you prepare. I highly recommend!

Professor Mojo is my new favorite professor. He truly cares that his students are successful in the class. He drops the 2 lowest test scores if you miss less than 3 classes. You also get study guides for each test and are allowed to bring a calculator with a page of "notes/formulas". If you go to class and take notes, you will pass.

His class is great. I hate math but Ive got a 99 going into the final. His tests are on computers in class and he drops 2 out of 5 if you have less than 4 absences. Final is 30% of your grade and multiple choice. He gives study guides which are almost identical to the tests. If you come to class and do your homework you will at least get a B
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--TEST HEAVY--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He gives many chances for you to pass the class. He drops the lowest test grades if you miss to class less than three times a semester. He has five tests a semester. His practice exams really help with the tests and he even lets you have a cheat sheet. He wants people to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: tests are super easy if you do hw and study guides
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Mojo is probably the best math professor Ive ever taken. I SUCK at math and Ive probably never received higher than a C in any math class but for once I actually think Ill get an A in this class. He allows students to use a sheet of paper to put anything you want on it. Write down the study guide questions bc its like the test.

If you struggle with math, I would recommend this professor. Your lowest test grade is dropped if you miss less than 4 classes. You are allowed a cheat sheet for each test and can use a graphing calculator. He gives a study guide that is just like the exam. Each chapter has a MathLab homework but they help with studying.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: He's an amazing, caring and kind man. If you don't understand something, ask him in class or see him after. Exams are online in class so bring your own computer. The study guide is the same as the test, different numbers. I used my study guide as a cheat sheet. Extra credit based on the class average. "TAKE YOUR TIME DURING THE TEST." Thank me ltr

Professor mojo did everything to make sure you Passed. The test are online and he puts a study guide online which is a replica of the test. Oh and you get to use a cheat sheet on every test . Ignore the bad reviews those are just lazy students who dont know how to use there resources :)

Very strong accent. It is almost impossible to understand. Goes through lectures as if students already know the material, goes on without explaining problems. His voice is very quiet and very hard to understand. Tests are online in class. Attendance is not mandatory but will drop lowest test grade if you miss less than 3 classes. Awful professor.

Bring your own laptop to class for tests online. If you feel like you deserve a point because of a little mistake on a test, talk to him when you are done with the test at that moment. He will either give you a pass on that question or not.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Mojo is a great professor. Yes,he has an accent but I never had problem understanding him. He allows you to have one piece of paper for a cheat sheet for each test and will drop the lowest grade of your test if you have miss class 4 times or less. Before I took his class I never liked and was never good at math. I would take him again!

If you have less than 4 absences he will get rid of your lowest test score. The tests are difficult but he lets you bring in 1 sheet of paper with anything you want to write on one side for the test. He also gives study guides and if the class average is too low he will give extra credit following the tests. lots of hw. good lectures.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT--Would take again

comment: Mojo is a really nice dude and An A In this class is very achievable. If you miss less than 4 classes he drops your lowest test grade and the study guides are just like the test. You get a cheat sheet to use during the test so the tests are very easy if you learn the study guide. Would definitely recommend

Professor Mojo was probably one of my favorite professors. He made sure his students understood the lesson before moving on. I went to his office hours for more help and he will reteach whatever you want him to reteach. The test is basically a replica of the study guide. It's an easy A!

Professor Mojo is a smart guy.  But, if you're not into math then he's not really the guy to take. All homework is online and so are the tests except the final. He drops the lowest grade if you have less than 5 absences. Sometimes asking questions can be difficult because of his accent and it may be hard for him to explain himself. It's a toss up.

I've taken Abebe twice and made an A both times. Everything is online (take tests online in class on  a laptop) except the final, which is in class. Lots of homework but it's easy. Use Mathway and I promise you will make an A. Drops the lowest test if you have less than 4 absences.

Nice guy with an accent but it's not a bad accent. Lots of my math lab work and all 4 tests were on there as well and he drops the lowest test grade if you have less than 4 absences. The study guides are key though since all the test questions come from those study guides. Overall solid choice for a professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Mojo is a very smart guy. At times he is hard to understand because he speaks soft and his accent but if you ask him to repeat something he will. The homework is all online and is easy to get 100s on. The tests are online as well, which makes them easier. Overall I would take him again. He drops your lowest test grade if you dont have 5 absences.

Professor Mojo is very boring. He doesn't interact w/ students AT ALL. Be prepared to be in a very awkward class. I heard he was a great professor but he wasn't! Chapter HW's are all due at once AFTER the test. All tests & hw's is on MyMathLab. Tests are short but difficult. After you take the test, CHECK & make sure MyMathLab graded you right.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: All of the work is online, so it's very easy to get 100's on all the homework assignments. Attendance isn't mandatory, but he drops your lowest test grade if you have less the 4 absences. Has a slight accent so he's a little difficult to understand sometimes, but he's very willing to repeat anything you might have a question on.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Drops lowest test grade if you have less than 4 absences. All work is done online except for final which is in class. If you have any questions he will make sure he answers it completely before he moves on. Homework is easy 100, tests are not too hard if you study - tests are taken on laptop in class but can use scratch paper.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Thorough, helpful, polite and friendly. Does have an accent but easy to understand.
Has a strong accent that you can't understand sometimes. Nice guy in general. Wouldn't recommend him for your 1st semester
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This mean really means well. He drops your lowest test grade if you have food attendance and lets you use a formula sheet. HOWEVER he is not a good math teacher. He makes everything seem more difficult than it really is. The online "my math lab" software that he uses explains the material better than he does and will help a lot
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Mr. Mojo was an excellent professor. He has a bit of an accent, but I've had previous professors that had one, so it's easy to understand. His grading is over homework assignments and tests. They're all online in MyMathLab and he drops your lowest test grade. He also lets you use a formula sheet for your tests, so take advantage of that on test day

Professor Mojo is a great professor. He respects all of his students. The class I took was calculus and almost everyone knows it's a tough class. He allows you to have one piece of paper for a cheat sheet for each test. I would recommend!
